attributes.action: Stop people entering sentences instead of their real name on e-petition signatures
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Some people are using sentences instead of their name when signing an e-petition to object to the e-petition subject. This is clearly oustide of the proper use of the e-petitions website. A good way of ensuring that only genuine names are entered would be to force the entry of the signatory's electoral roll number and registered voting name at the submitted address when signing an e-petition. A person's name will only appear on an e-petition signatory list after it has been checked against the electoral roll and confirmed as genuine.

rejection.details: Comments about the petitions system should be sent to number10@petitions.pm.gov.uk.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
